Here's the professional story of this candidate:

A culinary arts graduate with a passion for hospitality began their journey in 2007 as a Shift Supervisor and Host, where they first learned the ropes of restaurant management and staff training. After earning their Advanced Culinary Arts degree in 2010, they stepped into the role of Sous Chef, mastering various kitchen stations and improving operational efficiency.

Their career took an interesting turn as they moved into hotel operations, where they utilized their customer service skills as a Front Desk Agent at several properties. They continued their education while working, earning a Bachelor's in Hospitality Management in 2013, followed by an MBA in 2015, graduating with impressive honors (3.8 GPA, Magna Cum Laude).

As they advanced to Front Desk Manager, they became proficient in multiple reservation systems and gained expertise in guest services, night auditing, and rewards program management. Their diverse background in both culinary and hotel operations, combined with their advanced education, has shaped them into a well-rounded hospitality professional.

Throughout their career, they've maintained various certifications including TIPS, CPR-AED, and Food Handler certifications, demonstrating their commitment to safety and professional development. They were also proud to be part of the Hilton Garden Inn Opening Team in Woodbridge, Virginia.

Their core strengths lie in customer service, hospitality management, and problem-solving, with particular expertise in hotel operations, revenue management, and project management. This combination of hands-on experience, formal education, and professional certifications has created a versatile professional who understands both the front and back of house operations in the hospitality industry.
